item.title: Hybrid Riemannian conjugate gradient methods with global convergence properties
item.description: Hybrid Riemannian conjugate gradient methods with global convergence properties Link to heading Author: Hiroyuki Sakai, Hideaki Iiduka Journal: Computational Optimization and Applications 77: 811-830 (2020) URL: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10589-020-00224-9, GitHub: https://github.com/iiduka-researches/202008-hybrid-rcg Abstract Link to heading This paper presents Riemannian conjugate gradient methods and global convergence analyses under the strong Wolfe conditions. The main idea of the proposed methods is to combine the good global convergence properties of the Dai–Yuan method with the efficient numerical performance of the Hestenes–Stiefel method.
